result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Steinbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will allow the defendant to apply for expungement after 1 year, payment of all monies, completion of the AODA & any follow-up and no further violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Laura at GLSO.
Defendant in custody and present via video from the Winnebago CountyJail and without counsel.

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Winnebago County jail and without counsel.  FTP $579.00.  Court questions defendant regarding payment.  Statement by defendant, does not have a job at this time, lost it the end of April.  Statement by defendant, can't pay much after release.  Court orders a warrant, and stays that pending payments of $50 per month, with the first payment due the end of June or defendant is to call the COC with a reasonable explanation as to why he can't pay.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
sent to GLSO May 5, 2017
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

1:05 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned at 1:05 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob M Steinbach
Current: 826 Wright St, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 12-05-2016)
Prior: 6773 State Road 91, Pickett, WI 54964 United States
FTP Hearing April 24, 2017, for $579.00
of Change of Address (Defendant's) - new address is:  826 Wright St  Oshkosh, WI  54901

9:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine, costs, DNA, AODA and request for expungement.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

COURT sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court will allow expungement after 1 year, payment of all monies, completion of the AODA and any follow-up and no further violations.

Court adjourned at 9:11 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

2:35 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - this case is resolved.  Court sets for plea & Sentencing on December 5, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

10:44 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have Discovery and an offer and request a plea & sentencing date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 15, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:44 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Roeth enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court notes bond has been set - $500.00 signature bond. Court will set for Status Hearing on October 24, 2016 at 10:00 a.m..

Court adjourned at 2:51 p.m.
